intro: Andringitra leiomacrantha subsp. angustata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved leiomacrantha, is a rare flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded forest environments, often in rocky or mountainous regions. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
